w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic cafeteria phrases by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: lunch, kitchen, cook, refrigerator, stove, pot, pan, tray, I pick up trash in the cafeteria, I sit in the cafeteria
n of this lesson, students will be able to:
e the words for the cafeteria
sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: lunch, kitchen, cook, stove, pot, pan, tray

Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about the cafeteria.”

Review the two most important cafeteria rules:
I sit in the cafeteria, I pick up trash in the cafeteria.
Explain that these are the two most important rules in the cafeteria. Circle the first two pictures and encourage the child to say the phrase,
I pick up trash in the cafeteria.
Use the vocabulary and phrases from the lesson to talk about the picture (
tray, I sit in the cafeteria, table, cafeteria)
Point to your eyes and ask, “What do you see?” Encourage the child to say things they see in the picture that were taught in the lesson (
I sit in the cafeteria, cafeteria, tray, table).
Circle pictures to help prompt the student.
